site_title: Foreigners back India bonds over pricey stocks in tactical bet
summary: Foreign investors are pouring more money into India's sovereign bonds than stocks, drawn by relatively lower valuations and upcoming inclusion into global debt indexes. Since January 1, global funds have invested a net $4.1 billion in India's debt, while pulling $3.6 billion from local shares. India's bonds have risen due to improving finances, burgeoning foreign reserves, and lower valuations compared to global stocks, which have seen annual gains for eight years.

site_title: China holiday travel surge signals consumer spending pickup
summary: China's Chinese New Year holiday saw a surge in travel, with over 61 million rail trips taken in the first six days, a 61% increase from the same period in 2023. This signals a potential consumer spending pickup in the country's economy, which has been struggling with low confidence and deflation. Initial data on road and air trips also showed improvement, with hotel sales surging 60% and consumer spending on online platforms jumping 36%. The travel and spending data offer welcome news for an economy facing concerns about growth, a property crisis, and deflationary pressures.

images.alt_text: A dragon installation in Beijing, Feb 7, 2024.

site_title: Prada, XPeng and BeiGene may join Hong Kong’s stock benchmark
summary: Hong Kong's Hang Seng Index may add foreign stocks, including Prada, XPeng, and BeiGene, in its upcoming quarterly review. The move aims to expand the 82-member index to 100, achieving a more balanced representation of the city's stock market. The addition of foreign firms may signal more global companies to consider a listing in Hong Kong, despite the city's slumping market. The changes will take effect from March 4, with some firms, such as Hengan International Group and Country Garden Services Holdings, at risk of deletion.

images.alt_text: Hong Kong’s imports of industrial metals such as copper and aluminium are a small fraction of global supplies.

site_title: No Signboard interim CEO’s stake in white knight raises conflict-of-interest risk
summary: No Signboard's interim CEO Lim Teck-Ean owns 50% of Gazelle Capital, which in turn owns half of the white knight investor Gazelle Ventures. This creates a potential conflict of interest as Gazelle Ventures has offered investments and support to No Signboard. Lim Teck-Ean also remains on Gazelle Ventures' board, despite stepping down as its CEO. The company's advance deposit from Gazelle is classified as a loan, increasing its liabilities and debt levels, raising concerns about a potential conflict of interest and the impact on its financial performance.

images.alt_text: It appears that No Signboard is banking all its hopes on a memorandum of understanding for up to S$5 million in investments.
If No Signboard was trying to soothe rattled investors with its latest clarification announcement, it failed to do a good job.
Facade of No Signboard Seafood restaurant.

No Signboard has entered into a share sale and purchase agreement with Chia Shu Sian and its investor Gazelle Ventures for the proposed acquisition of 60 per cent of the entire issued and paid-up capital of Dining Haus.
The latest financial update comes just days after the group announced its financial results for the first half of the year on Nov 23.
The Singapore High Court has ruled in favour of No Signboard, its chief executive officer and chairman Lim Yong Sim, and its controlling shareholder GuGong.
No Signboard outlet at Esplanade.
No Signboard's closure of multiple outlets and subsidiary food businesses has resulted in losses and reduced revenue.
The High Court has ordered No Signboard to pay S$6,500 in costs.

site_title: Rubio urges SEC to block Shein IPO unless China operating risk disclosed
summary: US Senator Marco Rubio is urging the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) to block Chinese e-tailer Shein's initial public offering (IPO) unless the company discloses its business operations and "serious risks of doing business" in China. Rubio's letter to SEC chair Gary Gensler cites China's new rules allowing the China Securities Regulatory Commission to vet offshore listings and block offerings that could threaten national interests. Shein, which relies heavily on Chinese contract suppliers, has faced criticism over allegations of forced labor. Rubio's request is the latest obstacle for Shein's IPO attempt, which has been blocked by a bipartisan group of US lawmakers last May.

images.alt_text: FILE PHOTO: People shop at the Shein Holiday pop-up shop inside of Times Squares Forever 21 in New York City, U.S., November 10, 2023.REUTERS/David 'Dee' Delgado/File Photo

Textile-makers in the Carolinas, once a textile hub, contend that de minimis – nearly a century old, but exploding in use – motivates retailers to rely even more on foreign producers to keep prices low.
The Chinese government is also interested in the type of Chinese data that the company will disclose to regulators in the US as Shein seeks a listing there.

site_title: BOJ’s Ueda keeps pledge to review stimulus when price goal met
summary: Bank of Japan governor Kazuo Ueda pledged to review the central bank's stimulus measures when Japan achieves its 2% inflation target, despite exceeding it for over a year. Ueda stated that monetary conditions will remain accommodative even after ending negative interest rates, citing a favorable economic outlook. This comes as the yen continues to weaken, prompting warnings from Finance Minister Shunichi Suzuki about the negative aspects of a weak currency.

images.alt_text: The national flag flutters at the Bank of Japan headquarters in Tokyo on January 23, 2024. (Photo by Kazuhiro NOGI / AFP)

site_title: Singapore Institute of Advanced Medicine falls 17.4% below IPO price in Catalist debut
summary: Singapore Institute of Advanced Medicine (SAM) closed below its IPO price at S$0.195, down 15.2% from its offer price of S$0.23. The company raised S$26.2 million in gross proceeds, with net proceeds of S$21.7 million, which will be used for repaying bank borrowings, working capital, and acquiring new equipment. SAM's IPO was fully subscribed, with a 1.01 times subscription rate, and its founder and CEO, Dr. Djeng Shih Kien, expressed confidence in the company's growth and impact.

images.alt_text: Dr Djeng Shih Kien, founder and chief executive, said the IPO’s subscription rate was a “vote of confidence for the growth and impact yet to come”.
Incorporated in 2011 and founded by Dr Djeng Shih Kien, SIAMH focuses on diagnosing and treating various diseases and health conditions.
我国有三家医疗机构即将推出质子治疗（Proton Therapy），其中由新加坡高新医学研究所控股（Singapore Institute of Advanced Medicine Holdings，简称SAM）经营的中心除了从美国引进质子治疗系统，中心还须使用专门的高密度混凝土建造超过四米厚的墙，以防止质子辐射外泄。

site_title: Seatrium bags retrofit project for carbon-capture and storage system
summary: Seatrium has been awarded a contract to retrofit a 7-megawatt carbon-capture and storage system on Clipper Eris, an ethylene carrier owned by Solvang. The project, valued at full-scale, turnkey CCS retrofit on a liquefied petroleum gas (LPG) carrier, marks the world's first of its kind. The retrofit aims to capture 70% of carbon dioxide in exhaust gas using amine cleaning technology, with works scheduled to start in Q3. The project aims to contribute to maritime decarbonization and is part of Solvang's fleet director's plan to install the technology on newbuilds.

images.alt_text: Seatrium has bagged a five-year contract with GasLog LNG Services and Shell International Trading and Shipping Company to upgrade their fleet of LNG carriers.
Minority investors who supported Seatrium's rights issues and merger with KOM may feel the company is now adding insult to injury by writing down the value of some of its assets.
Seatrium expects greater operational productivity following the leaning down of assets and inventories.

site_title: DoorDash sees downbeat Q1 core profit as costs weigh
summary: DoorDash reported a wider-than-expected quarterly loss due to elevated labour costs and stiff competition from rivals. The company forecast core profit below estimates and its shares declined 7% in extended trading. Despite this, DoorDash expects 2024 adjusted Ebitda between $1.5 billion and $1.9 billion, above expectations, and reported a 23% increase in total orders in the fourth quarter. The company also authorised up to $1.1 billion in share repurchases.

images.alt_text: A Doordash delivery person rides their bike on Church Avenue in the Flatbush neighborhood of Brooklyn on December 4, 2020 in New York City. A rule issued January 9, 2024, by the US Labor Department making it tougher for companies to classify workers as "independent contractors" could take a toll on the gig economy -- and is likely to face challenges. This includes drivers of ride-hailing services such as Uber and Lyft, or delivery workers for companies like DoorDash. (Photo by Michael M. Santiago / GETTY IMAGES NORTH AMERICA / AFP)
DoorDash spreads beyond North America with Australia launch

site_title: Roku forecasts bigger first-quarter loss on stiff competition
summary: Roku forecasts a bigger first-quarter loss of 90 US cents per share, exceeding analyst expectations of 69 US cents. The company faces intense competition from streaming rivals such as Netflix and Amazon's Prime Video amid weak customer spending on video streaming. Roku has an exclusive deal with Walmart to sell products fulfilled by the retailer on its devices, but this may not be enough to mitigate the impact of stiff competition. The company's shares fell 15% in after-market trading.

images.alt_text: Roku has raised its quarterly revenue forecast, a sign that ad spending was continuing to improve thanks to cooling inflation and hopes of a pause in interest rate hikes.

site_title: Brokers’ take: RHB cuts ThaiBev target on lower earnings forecast; positive on recovery
summary: RHB Research cut its target price for Thai Beverage (ThaiBev) to S$0.76 from S$0.82, citing lower earnings forecasts for FY2024-2026 due to weaker sales in the beer segment. Despite this, the research team remains positive on the counter, citing strong market leadership in Thailand and Vietnam, and expects earnings growth in the latter part of the year. Analysts at RHB and DBS Group Research maintain a "buy" on ThaiBev, citing attractive valuation and potential upside of 45.5% and 53.5% respectively.

images.alt_text: ThaiBev's lower Q1 revenue came as the group’s beer segment revenue declined 14 per cent on-year to 32.6 billion baht from 37.9 billion baht.
The group will continue to be helmed by Charoen Sirivadhanabhakdi, who remains as chairman of the board of directors and executive chairman of ThaiBev.
Shares of ThaiBev, which owns Chang Beer, see heavy trading on Wednesday.
ThaiBev's Chang Beer. Both DBS and RHB maintain “buy” on the counter and perceived ThaiBev’s valuations to be attractive.

site_title: Mbappe tells PSG he plans to leave as saga draws to close
summary: Kylian Mbappe, captain of France and forward for Paris Saint-Germain, has informed officials that he plans to leave the team when his contract expires at the end of the season. Mbappe had extended his contract in 2022 until 2024 but declined to activate a one-year extension last summer. He has reportedly entered negotiations with Real Madrid, with whom he is widely tipped to join.

images.alt_text: UK business mogul Jim Ratcliffe struck an agreement in December to acquire, through his chemical conglomerate Ineos Group, a 25 per cent stake in Manchester United.
Blackstone’s decision comes after a ramping up of protests against private equity involvement in the sport’s top league, the Bundesliga, at the weekend.
Taylor Swift’s relationship with Travis Kelce is captivating the NFL and popular culture this season.
Messi’s no-show at the highly anticipated match in Hong Kong on Sunday caused a furore that has shown no sign of waning, with fans still demanding answers and a refund three days on.

site_title: Barclays among parties eyeing SocGen's UK private bank
summary: Barclays is considering a bid for Societe Generale's UK private bank, seeking to expand its business targeting wealthy individuals. The move comes as part of Barclays' efforts to diversify away from volatile investment banking income. The bank has also been reviewing its global payment activities and is set to present a strategy review next week. Other bidders, including Lloyds Banking Group and wealth managers Rathbones and Raymond James, have been invited to participate in an auction for Kleinwort Hambros, a UK private bank with £12 billion in assets under management.

images.alt_text: Barclays has pledged US$1 trillion of sustainable and transition finance by 2030.
Barclays also expects “energy clients to produce transition plans or decarbonisation strategies” by 2025.

site_title: The cycle vs the trend: Investors need to prepare for secular change
summary: Investors are shifting their focus from anticipating cyclical turning points to making long-term returns amid a new inflection point in markets. The current economic cycle is expected to be more benign, with inflation slowing and interest rates potentially cutting. However, a "postmodern cycle" is emerging, driven by factors such as AI, decarbonization, and geopolitical tensions, which will require investors to be more patient and willing to make difficult choices. As a result, investors need to prepare for secular change and consider the trend over the longer term rather than shorter-term fluctuations.

images.alt_text: Are we at the end of the equity cycle?
Alibaba headquarters in China's eastern Zhejiang province. Fundamentals of China's new-economy sector have remained resilient, and the sector is expected to shine again.

site_title: Oil rises over 1% after US data weighs on dollar
summary: Oil prices rose over 1% on Thursday after US retail data showed a sell-off in the US dollar, boosting oil prices as it makes the commodity cheaper for holders of other currencies. Brent crude futures settled at $82.86 a barrel, while US West Texas Intermediate crude futures rose to $78.03. However, an International Energy Agency report flagged slowing demand growth this year, limiting further gains.

images.alt_text: A view of the logo of the International Energy Agency in Paris, France, December 15, 2023. REUTERS/Sarah Meyssonnier

site_title: Stocks to watch: SIA, SIA Engineering, F&N, Singapore Institute of Advanced Medicine, Silverlake
summary: Singapore Airlines (SIA) reported a 14.4% year-on-year rise in group passenger traffic to 12.6 billion for January 2024. SIA Engineering Company (SIAEC) posted a net profit of S$26.9 million for its third quarter, with revenue increasing 40.2%. Fraser and Neave (F&N) leased an industrial land parcel in Cambodia for a dairy manufacturing facility. The Singapore Institute of Advanced Medicine will commence trading on Friday under the ticker 9G2, with its IPO closing nearly 1.4 times subscribed.

site_title: Apple readies AI tool to rival Microsoft’s GitHub Copilot
summary: Apple is nearing the completion of a new AI tool for app developers that will rival Microsoft's GitHub Copilot, a feature that uses artificial intelligence to predict and complete blocks of code. The tool, part of the next major version of Xcode, is expected to be released to third-party software makers as early as this year. Apple is also exploring the use of AI to generate code for testing applications and has promised to discuss its plans for AI later this year. The move is part of a broader push into generative AI and large language models, with Apple aiming to take a gradual approach to AI development.

images.alt_text: The Apple design team is tasked with devising the look and feel of devices and software, as well as developing new features and interfaces.
The EU's decision is a win for Apple and Microsoft, as they would have been obliged to adapt their services to meet a swathe of new obligations and prohibitions.
Apple has sued “stealth” startup Rivos in 2022.
Apple’s main rival in the space is Meta Platforms, the leader in VR with its Quest goggles.
FILE PHOTO: The Apple logo is seen hanging at the entrance to the Apple store on 5th Avenue in Manhattan, New York, U.S., October 16, 2019. REUTERS/Mike Segar/File Photo

site_title: F&N unit leases land for US$3.9 million to build dairy manufacturing facility in Cambodia
summary: F&N Holdings Berhad has leased a 32,200 sq m land parcel in Cambodia for US$3.9 million to build a dairy manufacturing facility. The facility, expected to start operations in 2026, will produce sweetened beverage creamer in can and pouch, strengthening F&N's presence in Cambodia. The total cost of setting up the facility is estimated to be US$37.5 million, including land leasing, construction, and machinery costs.

images.alt_text: FPL did not comment on news reports of a deal, or its surging share price, until the end of last week
ThaiBev's lower Q1 revenue came as the group’s beer segment revenue declined 14 per cent on-year to 32.6 billion baht from 37.9 billion baht.

site_title: How Gen AI will change asset management
summary: Generative artificial intelligence (Gen AI) is revolutionizing asset management, bringing both job destruction and enhancement. The industry's adoption of Gen AI is accelerating due to its main drivers – computing power, data, talent, and funding – compounding at a scale and speed that will accentuate its disruptive forces. Gen AI offers great promise in improving operational efficiency, protecting against cyber attacks, and enhancing communication with clients. However, the industry faces challenges, including biases, talent distribution, and regulatory issues, which will lead to major disruptions and a shift towards a handful of large firms and niche players, potentially resulting in job losses among mid-sized managers.

images.alt_text: Generative AI mimics the workings of the human brain to perform complex cognitive tasks based on simple written prompts.

site_title: US dollar steady, yen gains despite GDP surprise
summary: The US dollar index remained steady at 104.6, while the yen rose 0.37% to 150.05 yen, despite Japan's weak GDP figures. The yen's gain was attributed to upcoming spring wage negotiations, which may influence the Bank of Japan's policy outlook. The US retail sales data, scheduled for release, will provide more insight into the US economy's direction, and investors expect the dollar to remain stable unless there are significant surprises.

images.alt_text: The US dollar weakens against the yen after Japan's currency officials warned against what they described as rapid and speculative yen moves.

site_title: Coinbase posts profit on robust trading, higher interest income
summary: Coinbase reported a fourth-quarter profit of $273.4 million, driven by strong growth in transaction volumes and higher interest income from its stablecoin reserves. Total transaction revenue jumped 64% to $529.3 million, while stablecoin revenue rose 18% to $171.6 million. Interest income also increased 17% to $42.6 million. The company's shares rose 8% in extended trading following the announcement.

images.alt_text: Coinbase is asking the court to dismiss the Securities and Exchange Commission’s lawsuit alleging the largest US crypto exchange is flouting its rules.
Coinbase opens first US regulated bitcoin exchange
Coinbase accused of cheating consumers in more ways than one

site_title: European, US carmakers race to lower EVs costs as China competition heats up
summary: Major US and European carmakers, including Stellantis and Renault, are racing to lower the cost of electric vehicles (EVs) to compete with Chinese manufacturers. The high cost of EVs has slowed their adoption, with industry executives citing pressure from Chinese competitors. In response, US giants General Motors and Ford are exploring partnerships to reduce EV costs. European manufacturers are also developing more affordable EV models, while US companies are looking to cut costs to match profit margins of fossil-fuel models. The goal is to make EVs more competitive in the market.

images.alt_text: Ford is recalibrating its EV strategy as mainstream US consumers baulk at the high price of battery-powered models and the spotty charging infrastructure
Sales of fully-electric cars, or battery electric vehicles (BEVs), and plug-in hybrids hit 1.1 million globally in January, up from 660,000 in January 2023.
Major US automakers have warned that Chinese cars could spell doom for their own prospects, among them Elon Musk’s Tesla.
China is estimated to have overtaken Japan as the world’s largest auto exporter in 2023.

site_title: China set to bide time on rate cut until yuan, data stabilise
summary: China's central bank is expected to keep monetary policy stable, with no rate cut until the yuan stabilizes and economic data improves. The People's Bank of China will leave the one-year policy loan rate at 2.5% as soon as Sunday, February 18. Analysts predict little change in MLF issuance, with a focus on managing liquidity after the Chinese New Year holiday. The move aims to address the country's sluggish economy and diverging monetary policy from the US, which is putting pressure on the local currency.

images.alt_text: “Prudent monetary policy should be flexible, moderate, precise and effective... and keep the scale of social financing and the money supply in line with the expected goals of economic growth and price levels,” the bank said.
Banks are estimated to have issued 4.5 trillion yuan (S$844 billion) in net new yuan loans last month, more than tripling the 1.17 trillion yuan in December.
The People’s Bank of China has rarely made such a broad easing move so close to the break.

site_title: Carousell co-founder Lucas Ngoo to step down
summary: Carousell co-founder Lucas Ngoo is stepping down from managing day-to-day operations, but will remain as a co-founder and board director. In a LinkedIn post, Ngoo expressed confidence in the company's business and leadership team, and stated he has full vested interests in Carousell's success. He will also act as an adviser when necessary.

images.alt_text: Quek Siu Rui, CEO and co-founder of Carousell Singapore, says that the company has the support of long-term investors.
Carousell co-founder Quek Siu Rui admitted that he was too optimistic about the investment Carousell was making in hiring versus the platform's impact.
Carousell chief Quek Siu Rui (centre) with Laku6 co-founders Alvin Yap (left) and Heng Shing Kae

site_title: SIIC Environment CFO leaves to ‘pursue career developments’
summary: SIIC Environment's CFO Tang Congliang has resigned to pursue career changes, effective immediately. His duties will be taken over by the deputy CFO. The company is looking to identify a suitable replacement and will inform shareholders as necessary. Tang joins other recent departures, including the non-executive chairman's resignation in November and the CEO's change in September. The company's shares closed unchanged at S$0.192 following the announcement.

images.alt_text: SIIC Environment said that it has actively deployed high-quality projects and will keep expanding its wastewater and sludge treatment business as the business sees favourable policy support.

site_title: Jeff Bezos unloads another US$2 billion of Amazon stock in latest sale
summary: Jeff Bezos has sold another 12 million shares of Amazon, valued at US$2 billion, as part of a plan to dispose of up to 50 million shares. This brings the total sold to over US$6 billion, with 36 million shares already sold. The timing of the sales may be related to his move to Miami, which is expected to save him about US$430 million in taxes due to Florida's lower capital gains tax rate. Bezos has not explained why he is selling his shares.

site_title: AI is bridging S-E Asia’s cultural and language gaps
summary: South-east Asia is experiencing a cultural and language revolution thanks to AI-driven language translation and processing technologies, bridging gaps and increasing access to information. The region's economy is expected to grow by 10-18% by 2030, driven by a surge in AI adoption, with 76% of Asia-Pacific businesses using AI tools last year. However, challenges remain, including a lack of AI expertise, inadequate data governance, and infrastructure gaps. The technology has the potential to democratize information, enhance education, and promote cultural exchange, but it also requires ethical and inclusive AI development practices.

images.alt_text: In IMDA’s view, existing governance frameworks for these AI models need to be reviewed to foster a broader, trusted ecosystem.

site_title: Microsoft’s Xbox to release four titles on external platforms
summary: Microsoft's Xbox will release four video-game titles on external platforms, marking a shift towards more accessibility. Gaming CEO Phil Spencer stated that games exclusive to one piece of hardware will become less prevalent in the next 5-10 years. The titles, which have been available to Xbox players for at least a year, do not include Starfield or the upcoming Indiana Jones title. This move comes as the growth environment for multi-game subscription services is expected to slow this year, according to research firm NewZoo.

images.alt_text: A Microsoft Xbox One video game controller. Photographer: Michael Ciaglo/Bloomberg

site_title: Applied Materials sees quarterly revenue above estimates on AI boom
summary: Applied Materials, a semiconductor equipment supplier, forecasted better-than-expected second-quarter revenue due to strong demand for AI-embedded chips and personal computers. The company reported $6.71 billion in first-quarter revenue, beating estimates, and expects $6.5 billion in second-quarter revenue. CEO Gary Dickerson attributed the growth to increased capital investment by cloud companies and rising demand for chipmaking equipment. The company's shares rose 12% after the announcement, and analysts expect the trend to benefit companies like Applied Materials and rival Lam Research, driven by the push for domestic semiconductor supply chains.

images.alt_text: FILE PHOTO: A smartphone with a displayed Applied Materials logo is placed on a computer motherboard in this illustration taken March 6, 2023. REUTERS/Dado Ruvic/Illustration/File Photo

site_title: AI adoption increasing sales in telecoms sector, Nvidia report shows
summary: US telecom professionals report a significant increase in AI adoption, with 66% saying their companies will boost AI investment in 2024, up from 47% last year. Around two-thirds of respondents saw increased sales due to AI, with nearly 20% experiencing revenue growth above 10%. The top priority for telcos is improving customer experiences, followed by cost reduction and productivity boosting. However, data scientists, quantifying ROI, and poor technology infrastructure remain major roadblocks to implementing AI in the sector.

images.alt_text: Nvidia will release its quarterly earnings results on Feb 21.
FILE PHOTO: NVIDIA logo is seen near computer motherboard in this illustration taken January 8, 2024. REUTERS/Dado Ruvic/Illustration/File Photo
Mizuho in a client note raised its price target for Nvidia’s stock to US$825 from US$625 ahead of the Santa Clara, California, company’s quarterly results due on Feb 21.

site_title: Budget 2024 can help businesses stay resilient amid uncertainty
summary: Singapore's Budget 2024 aims to support businesses amid uncertainty, focusing on digitalisation, sustainability, and internationalisation. The budget is seen as a timely platform to drive growth and resilience for enterprises. KPMG's research shows that CEOs globally view geopolitics as the greatest risk to business growth, with Singapore's businesses adjusting their strategies. Despite expected economic growth, businesses remain cautious, and the government's initiatives will be crucial in navigating the challenging global environment.

images.alt_text: SBF chief executive officer Kok Ping Soon (left), and Lee Sze Yeng, managing partner of KPMG in Singapore, at the release of a joint Budget 2024 wish list on Monday (Jan 8).
One suggested move was to reintroduce estate duties or inheritance taxes, with rates varying by property value and type.

According to UOB's survey, 84 per cent of businesses said they were somewhat or highly affected by inflation, with its effects being most felt in the industrials, oil and gas as well as manufacturing and engineering sectors.
Deputy Prime Minister and Minister for Finance Lawrence Wong will deliver the 2024 Budget Statement in Parliament at 3.30 pm on Feb 16.

site_title: US homebuilder sentiment climbed to six-month high in February
summary: US homebuilder sentiment reached a six-month high in February, rising to 48, according to the National Association of Home Builders (NAHB)/Wells Fargo gauge. This rebound is attributed to declining mortgage rates, which fell below 7% in December. Despite rising interest rates, the NAHB expects single-family starts to rise 5% this year. Builder sentiment improved across all four US regions, with the West and Northeast experiencing especially strong gains.

images.alt_text: The Commerce Department says that construction spending rose 0.9 per cent.
Buyers have been sidelined by high mortgage rates, which hit a recent peak in October at 7.79 per cent.
The National Association of Realtors (NAR) Pending Home Sales index rises 8.3 per cent to 77.3, rebounding from a downwardly revised record-low of 71.4 in November.
Purchases of new single-family homes increase 8 per cent to a 664,000 annual pace last month, after an upward revision to November’s figure.
The Mortgage Bankers Association’s (MBA) index of mortgage applications to buy a home increases 7.5 per cent to 174.3 in the week ended Jan 19.
Contract closings decrease 1 per cent from a month earlier to a 3.78 million annualised rate, according to National Association of Realtors (NAR) data.

site_title: US factory production declines for first time in three months
summary: US factory production declined 0.5% in January for the first time in three months, following a 0.1% gain in December. This decline was mainly due to a 0.2% drop in motor vehicle and parts production. Excluding autos, manufacturing decreased 0.6% from December, marking the fourth-straight monthly decline. Recent surveys indicate a possible end to the malaise, but high borrowing costs and sluggish export markets may hinder sustained improvement in manufacturing.

site_title: Google rolls out updated AI model capable of handling longer text, video
summary: Google has released an updated version of its AI model, Gemini 1.5 Pro, capable of handling longer text and video inputs than its predecessor. The mid-size model can process up to an hour's worth of video, 11 hours of audio, or over 700,000 words in a document, making it more flexible and powerful than competitors. Gemini 1.5 Pro is available to cloud customers and developers for testing and eventual commercial applications, with Google seeking to attract corporate clients to demonstrate its investment in generative AI technology.

images.alt_text: The new facility will host a total of 300 scientists and engineers who had previously been scattered around other Google offices around Paris.
Microsoft has said that its Windows 10 will reach the end of support on Oct 14 2025, and will no longer provide regular security updates, bug fixes, or technical support.
Last month, Google has announced it would invest US$1 billion into building a data centre just outside of London.

site_title: Baby blues meet silver tsunami
summary: Singapore's population is expected to reach 25% of citizens aged 65 and over by 2030, with the working-age population bearing an increasingly heavy dependency cost. The country's CPF savings, while providing a solid foundation for retirement, are insufficient to support an independent dependent population. The author suggests that concrete steps, such as portable private pension schemes and exempting pension payouts, are needed to address this issue, rather than relying on vague acknowledgements about encouraging a healthier ageing population.

images.alt_text: Pension systems need rapid reforms: EY
CPF best retirement scheme in Asia, but lacks adequacy: Mercer
Corporate income tax is the largest source of tax revenue for Singapore, but watchers see limited room for raising the rate.

site_title: The rise of consumer crypto
summary: Blockchain technology is shifting from its initial focus on cryptocurrencies to broader consumer applications, particularly through non-fungible tokens (NFTs). Companies are using NFTs to create digital brand-building models, such as virtual sneakers and membership passes. This trend is gaining traction, with growing interest and investment in blockchain-based digital goods. The US Securities and Exchange Commission's approval of a spot Bitcoin ETF in January marks a step towards mainstream acceptance. As a result, blockchain technology is expanding its reach beyond traditional cryptocurrency enthusiasts.

images.alt_text: Blockchain: the next Internet wave?

site_title: Google opens Paris research hub as France seeks bigger AI role
summary: Google has opened a new research hub in Paris, housing 300 scientists and engineers, as France aims to establish itself as a key European center for artificial intelligence. The facility, which was inaugurated by Alphabet CEO Sundar Pichai and French Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire, will cater to startups, academics, and other companies. This move comes as France positions itself against rivals like Microsoft and OpenAI, with recent successes including the valuation of a French OpenAI rival at $2 billion. The hub is part of Google's efforts to keep pace in the rapidly evolving AI landscape.

site_title: US retail sales fall sharply in January; weekly jobless claims decline
summary: US retail sales dropped 0.8% in January, exceeding expectations, due to declines in auto dealerships and petrol service stations. The decline was likely influenced by winter storms. Despite this, consumer spending remains healthy, driven by a resilient labor market and rising household purchasing power. Initial jobless claims fell 8,000 to 212,000 for the week ended February 10, indicating a tight labor market.

images.alt_text: The producer price index for final demand dropped 0.2 per cent in December instead of dipping 0.1 per cent as previously reported.

site_title: Commercial property crisis ensnares Deutsche Pfandbriefbank as S&P downgrades rating
summary: S&P Global Ratings downgraded Deutsche Pfandbriefbank's credit rating to BBB-, one step above junk, citing high exposure to the US commercial property market. The downgrade led to a 12% drop in shares and a decline in bond prices. Analysts predict a 3.9% non-performing loans ratio at the end of 2023 due to the bank's significant exposure to commercial real estate, particularly in the office and retail segments. The European Central Bank may increase capital requirements for lenders with insufficient risk management.

images.alt_text: FILE PHOTO: The skyline with its office buildings and the banking district are photographed during sunset as the spread of the coronavirus disease (COVID-19) continues and the German government plans new pandemic control measures in Frankfurt, Germany, November 18, 2021.  REUTERS/Kai Pfaffenbach/File Photo##########pic##########

An empty office space in a building in San Francisco, California, US, on Tuesday, Dec. 5, 2023. San Francisco's office vacancy rate reached a record 34% in the third quarter, according to the real estate brokerage CBRE Group. Photographer: David Paul Morris/Bloomberg

site_title: US Federal Reserve releases scenarios for 2024 bank “stress tests”
summary: The US Federal Reserve released scenarios for its annual bank stress tests, which will assess 32 large lenders' resilience under severe economic shocks, including a 10% unemployment rate and 36% decline in house prices. The tests, introduced after the 2007-2009 financial crisis, will attract heightened scrutiny amid growing concerns over commercial real estate exposure. This year's test is broadly in line with last year's, and it will include an exploratory analysis of the banking system for the first time, testing lenders' resilience to wider risks.

images.alt_text: Traders previously betting on a rate cut at the Federal Reserve's Apr 30-May 1 meeting now see June as more likely.

Federal Reserve chairman Jerome Powell at a news conference following a Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) meeting in Washington, DC, on Jan 31, 2024. The Fed held interest rates steady for the fourth straight meeting and signalled its openness to cutting them, though not necessarily right away.

epa11116557 US Federal Reserve Board Chairman Jerome Powell is seen in a camera viewfinder as he speaks to reporters after the Fed once again refrained from raising interest rates following its two-day conference at the Federal Reserve in Washington, DC, USA, 31 January  2024. Policymakers are widely expected to begin cutting interest rates later in 2024.  EPA-EFE/JIM LO SCALZO

site_title: US: Wall St opens flat after mixed economic data
summary: US stocks opened flat on Thursday, February 15, 2024, after mixed economic data. The Dow Jones Industrial Average fell 26.33 points, or 0.07%, to 38,397.94. The S&P 500 and Nasdaq Composite indexes initially opened higher, but later settled flat. Investors are assessing the data for clues on the US Federal Reserve's first interest-rate cut. The mixed economic data sparked uncertainty, leading to a lack of direction on Wall Street.

site_title: Singapore Institute of Advanced Medicine’s IPO fully subscribed
summary: Singapore Institute of Advanced Medicine (SAM) Holdings' initial public offering (IPO) has closed with all 114 million new shares subscribed at S$0.23 apiece, exceeding expectations. The IPO raised S$26.2 million in gross proceeds, with net proceeds going towards repaying bank borrowings, working capital, and equipment upgrades. Controlling shareholder Espeetex, a subsidiary of Berjaya Group, subscribed for 12.8 million shares, increasing its stake to 24.5%. The IPO's subscription rate is seen as a "vote of confidence for the growth and impact yet to come" for the company.

images.alt_text: 我国有三家医疗机构即将推出质子治疗（Proton Therapy），其中由新加坡高新医学研究所控股（Singapore Institute of Advanced Medicine Holdings，简称SAM）经营的中心除了从美国引进质子治疗系统，中心还须使用专门的高密度混凝土建造超过四米厚的墙，以防止质子辐射外泄。
Incorporated in 2011 and founded by Dr Djeng Shih Kien, SIAMH focuses on diagnosing and treating various diseases and health conditions.
SGX has introduced several initiatives in 2023 to diversify the local market.

site_title: US import prices post largest gain in nearly two years in January
summary: US import prices rose 0.8% in January, the largest gain since March 2022, driven by increases in petroleum and other goods. This trend could worsen inflation. Import prices, excluding tariffs, fell 1.3% in the 12 months through January, marking the 12th consecutive month of decline. The Federal Reserve has raised interest rates to combat inflation, with markets now expecting rate cuts to be pushed back to June.

images.alt_text: Retail sales dropped 0.8 per cent last month, the Commerce Department’s Census Bureau said on Thursday (Feb 15), also likely weighed down by winter storms.

site_title: New York pension fund further restricts investments in Exxon, other oil companies
summary: The New York State Common Retirement Fund has restricted its investments in eight integrated oil and gas companies, including Exxon Mobil, due to their readiness to transition to a low-carbon economy. The fund, worth $280 billion, has nearly $26.8 million in holdings from the companies to be divested and restricted. This move follows a review by Comptroller Thomas DiNapoli, who oversees retirement assets, and is the third-largest US state pension fund to take such a step. Exxon did not immediately respond to a comment request.

site_title: Microsoft to invest 3.2 billion euros in Germany in AI push
summary: Microsoft plans to invest 3.2 billion euros in Germany over the next two years, focusing on artificial intelligence. The majority of the investment will be spent on setting up data centers and training people in AI in 2024 and 2025. Microsoft chairperson Brad Smith expressed confidence in Germany, stating it's the "enormous confidence" behind the investment. This is Microsoft's largest investment in Germany in 40 years.

site_title: Europe: French, German stocks sprint to record high on earnings cheer
summary: European stocks surged to record highs on Thursday, driven by upbeat corporate earnings and positive comments from European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde on the disinflation process. France's CAC 40 rose 0.9% and Germany's DAX hit an intra-day record high, with top performers including Renault and Commerzbank. Investors also drew on Lagarde's comments, which suggested the ECB has room to cut interest rates. The Stoxx 600 index closed up 0.6% at an over two-year high, with Goldman Sachs raising its 2024 target to 510 points.

images.alt_text: The German share price index DAX graph is pictured at the stock exchange in Frankfurt, Germany, February 15, 2024.     REUTERS/Staff

site_title: Top real estate picks in the Year of the Dragon
summary: Singaporeans remain enthusiastic about real estate, despite tougher legislations. The BT Property Outlook Seminar 2024 will take place on Feb 24, featuring a panel of experts to discuss investment opportunities, the impact of an ageing population, and market trends. The event will cover residential, commercial, and industrial properties, and attendees can ask questions and network with experts. Registration is limited, and details can be found at bt.sg/btproperty24.

images.alt_text: The annual BT Property Outlook Seminar will return in February.

site_title: SIA Engineering Q3 net profit more than doubles to S$26.9 million
summary: SIA Engineering Company (SIAEC) reported a net profit of S$26.9 million for its third quarter, more than doubling from S$12.8 million last year. Revenue increased 40.2% to S$291.7 million, driven by strong demand for aircraft maintenance and repair services. The company's nine-month net profit rose to S$86.2 million, up 90.3% from the previous year. Despite supply-chain challenges, SIAEC expects strong global air travel demand and will focus on cost management and productivity to remain competitive.

images.alt_text: The hangars at Sultan Abdul Aziz Airport, each being able to fit two wide-body aircraft, will boost SIAEC's airframe check capacity in providing comprehensive maintenance, repair and overhaul of current and next-generation aircraft for its expanding portfolio of airline customers, the company said.

site_title: US: Stocks advance, shrugging off weak retail sales data
summary: US stocks rose 0.9% on Thursday, overcoming weak January retail sales data. The Dow Jones Industrial Average gained 38,773.12, while the S&P 500 rose 0.6% to 5,029.73. Tech stocks were pressured, with Cisco Systems falling 2.4% due to job cuts. Oil producers Chevron and Apache jumped amid rising Middle East tensions. The market's gains brought it back to pre-sell-off levels after Tuesday's inflation report, with some stocks, like Deere & Company, falling due to a sober outlook.

images.alt_text: FILE PHOTO: Traders work on the floor at the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) in New York City, U.S., January 9, 2024.  REUTERS/Brendan McDermid//File Photo

site_title: Nokia, Dell agree to partnership on private 5G, cloud networks
summary: Nokia and Dell Technologies have agreed to a partnership to deploy private 5G networks and adapt networks to the cloud. The companies will integrate Nokia's Digital Automation Cloud with Dell's NativeEdge software platform, enabling customers to migrate to Dell's PowerEdge servers and use Nokia's Digital Automation Cloud as a preferred private wireless platform. The partnership aims to advance open network architectures in the telecom ecosystem and private 5G use cases among businesses.

images.alt_text: Nokia currently supplies 4G and 5G technology that allows in-house communications or helps industrial companies connect to data from machine sensors, among other uses.

FILE PHOTO: A view shows Nokia headquarters in Espoo, Finland, October 19, 2023. JUSSI NUKARI/Lehtikuva/via REUTERS      ATTENTION EDITORS - THIS IMAGE WAS PROVIDED BY A THIRD PARTY.
