site_title: US: Stocks rebound as buyers take advantage of drop
summary: US stocks rebounded on Thursday, with the Dow Jones Industrial Average up 1.0% at 38,519.84, and the S&P 500 and Nasdaq Composite Index rising 1.3% each. The rebound comes after a pullback on Wednesday, which was sparked by Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell's comments on interest rates. Despite Powell's comments, futures markets suggest a 38% chance of a Fed rate cut in March. Major tech companies, including Amazon, Microsoft, and Apple, enjoyed a positive session, while Peloton Interactive and New York Community Bancorp fell due to disappointing earnings reports.

images.alt_text: The Dow Jones Industrial Average rises 25.04 points, or 0.07 per cent, at the open to 38,175.34.

site_title: Are the myths of Pandora and Prometheus a parable for AI?
summary: A San Francisco Ballet production, "Mere Mortals," reimagines the ancient Greek myths of Prometheus and Pandora for the age of artificial intelligence. The ballet, directed by Tamara Rojo, explores the moral questions surrounding AI's impact on humanity. The story features a futuristic setting, dry ice, and strobe lights, with AI-generated visuals displayed on large screens behind the dancers. The performance ultimately offers a message of hope, as the dancers come together to lift one character above the rest, symbolizing the potential for AI to bring people together rather than tear them apart.

images.alt_text: As it becomes easier to generate historical disinfo and as the sheer volume of digital fakes explodes, the opportunity will become available to reshape history or at least to call our current understanding of it into question.

site_title: The six biggest ways wine will change in 2024
summary: Wine trends for 2024 include a rise in sparkling wine consumption, with a focus on more plentiful and delicious options. Climate change is expected to impact the wine industry, with unpredictable harvests and varying effects on different regions. Drinkers' taste preferences are shifting towards whites, particularly sauvignon blanc. The wine world is also embracing technological advancements, with robots potentially playing a role in harvesting and pouring sparkling wine. As the industry adapts to climate change, wine enthusiasts can expect a diverse and evolving wine landscape in 2024.

images.alt_text: Sauvignon Blanc displays regional differences that offer a wide choice in the style of wine.

Within France, shipments of champagne have fallen to the lowest level in almost four decades excluding 2020.
“This negative scenario can be attributed to significant declines in major wine-producing countries in both Hemispheres,” the OIV says.

site_title: Europe: shares slip on disappointing updates from banks, drugmakers
summary: European shares slipped 0.5% on February 1, weighed down by disappointing updates from banks and drugmakers Roche and Sanofi. Banks, led by BNP Paribas' 9.2% drop, fell 2.0% as they reported lower-than-expected income and profitability targets. Meanwhile, Volvo Cars and Ferrari rose 26.4% and 9.2%, respectively, as they reported strong quarterly earnings and growth expectations. The European Central Bank's easing inflation data boosted the argument for rate cuts, but risks remain to the upside.

images.alt_text: The pan-European Stoxx 600 index has held steady at 485.67 at close, logging a 1.4 per cent rise in January, its third consecutive monthly gain.

site_title: US construction spending rises more than expected in December
summary: US construction spending rose 0.9% in December, exceeding expectations, driven by a surge in single-family homebuilding. This marks a 13.9% year-over-year increase, with spending on new single-family construction projects jumping 1.6%. The surge is attributed to a perennial shortage of previously owned homes and lower mortgage rates. Economists expect further gains this year as interest rates are expected to decline, with the Federal Reserve leaving rates unchanged.

images.alt_text: Buyers have been sidelined by high mortgage rates, which hit a recent peak in October at 7.79 per cent.
The National Association of Realtors (NAR) Pending Home Sales index rises 8.3 per cent to 77.3, rebounding from a downwardly revised record-low of 71.4 in November.
Purchases of new single-family homes increase 8 per cent to a 664,000 annual pace last month, after an upward revision to November’s figure.
The Mortgage Bankers Association’s (MBA) index of mortgage applications to buy a home increases 7.5 per cent to 174.3 in the week ended Jan 19.
Contract closings decrease 1 per cent from a month earlier to a 3.78 million annualised rate, according to National Association of Realtors (NAR) data.

site_title: Dollar edges up as March Fed cut bets unwind, sterling trims losses after BOE
summary: The US dollar rose slightly on Thursday after Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell pushed back against bets of early US rate cuts, while sterling cut losses after the Bank of England reiterated that policy would need to stay "restrictive for sufficiently long." The US dollar index rose to 103.63, near a recent high. Euro fell to a seven-week low, and the yen and Swiss franc remained steady. The Fed outcome sent US Treasury yields lower, reinforcing a rush to bonds driven by renewed jitters over regional US banks.

site_title: Tata, Pegatron in partnership talks for iPhone assembly in India’s Tamil Nadu: sources
summary: Tata Group is in advanced talks with Taiwan's Pegatron to form a partnership to assemble iPhones in India's Tamil Nadu, specifically at the company's second plant in Hosur city. This move aims to speed up manufacturing plans as Apple and its contract manufacturers expand India operations. The joint venture would be Tata's first of its kind, following its successful first iPhone assembly plant in Karnataka, which it took over from Wistron last year.

site_title: US jobless claims rise to two-month high as labour market cools
summary: US jobless claims rose to a two-month high of 224,000 in the week ending Jan 27, according to the Labor Department. Initial claims increased by 9,000, exceeding economists' median forecast of 212,000. Continuing claims rose to 1.9 million, and weekly claims are volatile. The US labor market is showing signs of cooling, with fewer people quitting jobs and recent high-profile job cuts. Despite this, the Federal Reserve described the labor market as "strong" and "getting back into balance."

site_title: Frasers Hospitality Trust Q1 RevPAR improves across markets amid resilient tourism demand
summary: Frasers Hospitality Trust (FHT) reported a year-on-year increase in revenue per available room (RevPAR) across its portfolios in Q1 2024, driven by resilient tourism demand. The trust observed sustained recovery in markets such as Australia, the UK, Japan, and Malaysia, with RevPAR growth ranging from 5.7% to 22.1%. However, its Singapore portfolio saw declines in operating metrics due to competitive pressure. The trust's stapled group closed at S$0.46 on Friday, down 2.1%.

summary: CapitaLand Ascendas Reit's (Clar) second-half distribution per unit (DPU) fell 6.1% to S$0.07441, despite a 11% rise in gross revenue to S$761.7 million and a 4.6% increase in net property income to S$514.3 million, for the six months ended Dec 31, 2023.

site_title: Striking airport security staff ground flights across Germany
summary: A 24-hour strike by 25,000 airport security workers in Germany, called by union Verdi, has grounded flights across the country's 11 major airports, including Frankfurt and Hamburg. The strike, which began on February 1, demands a 2.80 euros per hour pay rise and more generous overtime. The strike has affected nearly 200,000 travelers, with over 1,100 flights canceled or delayed. The union claims high inflation has hurt its members and that safety in air traffic does not come for free.

site_title: Hamilton set for shock switch to Ferrari in 2025: reports
summary: Lewis Hamilton is reportedly set to switch from Mercedes to Ferrari in 2025, with the move expected to extend his current contract into the 2026 engine era. The seven-time Formula One world champion, 39, has been linked to Ferrari for years, despite signing a new two-year deal with Mercedes last August. Ferrari's Charles Leclerc has also signed on for several more seasons, and a move to Ferrari would be Hamilton's potential swansong, with the 2026 rule changes offering a new challenge.

images.alt_text: Petronas has been a sponsor of the Mercedes team since 2010, with the partnership bearing eight constructors’ and seven drivers’ world championships.

site_title: Lendlease Global Commercial Reit H1 DPU down 14.5% to S$0.021
summary: Lendlease Global Commercial Real Estate Investment Trust (Lendlease Reit) reported a 14.5% decline in distribution per unit (DPU) to S$0.021 for its first half ended Dec 31, 2023, due to higher borrowing costs amid higher interest rates. Despite a 17.9% increase in gross revenue to S$119.9 million, and a 22.2% year-on-year increase in net property income to S$93.4 million, distributable income declined 12% to S$49.3 million. The Reit's committed occupancy rate stood at 99.6% for its retail portfolio.

site_title: Footwear maker Bata India’s Q3 profit slumps on sluggish demand
summary: Bata India reported a 30% drop in Q3 profit to 579.8 million rupees, its third consecutive decline, due to sluggish demand and higher expenses. Revenue rose 4.8% to 9.03 billion rupees, its slowest growth since 2019. The company's inventory-related costs more than doubled, and it opened 54 new franchise stores. Bata India is in talks with Adidas for a strategic partnership and shares settled 2% lower ahead of the earnings.
